text: Letters: Florida Gators coach's terrible COVID call, pro-life voters, Trump's behaviorNews Sports Restaurants Entertainment Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals  LETTERSLetters: Gators coach made a terrible call on COVIDPalm Beach Post ReadersI guess that Dan Mullen, football coach of the Florida Gators, is exempt from well-deserved ridicule, after testing positive (along with 21 players or staffers) for COVID-19 only several days after lobbying for “90,000 people in the stands” for Florida’s next game. His words represented an irresponsible dismissal of the threat of COVID. His exhortation for a big crowd in the stands came after Florida lost to Texas A&M.  Instead of blaming the loss on Florida’s consistently poor defense in multiple games, Mullen feebly claimed that Texas A&M’s crowd size made the difference in the game.  While Mullen should be embarrassed and issuing apologies, I have not seen evidence of either. Marshall Brass, West Palm Beach Pro-life voter caresabout children, momsIn response to the letter arguing that "pro-life" voters shouldn't be tied to one party (Oct. 16), I would like to clarify. Voting with one's conscience and morals is what my privilege entails. I will vote for the person who aligns best with my views and who has accomplished things in his or her tenure in office.I have a clear choice. As to the statement that I cannot be pro-life and not simultaneously care about that life and the child's health nutrition and education, I can and do! I volunteer at a women's outreach program and see women every day, helping them to keep their unborn babies by providing financial and emotional support. We provide free testing, ultrasound and proof of pregnancy forms, community resources for housing, free education classes, food assistance and car seats.Our generous donors at Birthline Lifeline help these moms by donating baby items used during the first year of the child's life. Every three months they can come in for material assistance (formula, diapers, clothing, baby furniture). Our program is partially funded by the state of Florida, which also cares about women's choices and the child's prenatal care and health through programs such as Medicaid.I am the voice of the voiceless in the womb who cannot vote...and I will always vote for the pro-life candidate.Phyllis Trainor, Boynton Beach Trump acts like bullywho's mad that he's losingTrump called Dr. Anthony Fauci, a world eminent physician, a “disaster and an idiot" for his pandemic advice.Trump’s behavior is like a childish schoolyard bully lashing out because his team is losing with one minute to go in the game. He is behaving irrationally and libelous.We need an adult in the White House.Harriet Pashman, Jupiter The Palm Beach Post is committed to publishing a diversity of opinion.
